examples: the streams that ran under the melting glaciers
vast stores of oil under Alaska

preposition.description: Lower than (a specified amount, rate, norm, or age)

examples: the country is now under martial law
weaving the body through the crossbars, over and under, over and under
he was floating for some time but suddenly went under

adjective.description: Denoting the lowest part or surface of something; on the underside.
examples: the under part of the shell is concave

adjective.description: Unconscious, typically as a result of general anesthesia.
examples: the operation was quick—she was only under for 15 minutes

origin: Old English, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch onder and German unter.
